member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools
member.summary: Unlike traditional Mono/.NET, code on the iPhone is statically compiled ahead of time instead of being compiled on demand by a JIT compiler. This means there are a few limitations with respect to generics, these are caused because not every possible generic instantiation can be determined up front at compile time. The Aot Compiler is designed to overcome the limitations of this compiler. None of the methods in this class should ever be called, the code only has to exist at compile-time to be picked up by the AoT compiler. (Very similar to the LinkerIncludes.cs technique used in Xamarin.Android projects.)

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.SeedEverything
member.summary: This is the method that seeds the AoT compiler. None of these seed methods needs to actually be called to seed the compiler. The calls just need to be present when the code is compiled, and each implementation will be built.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.Seed``1
member.summary: Seeds the compiler using the given pixel format.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCompileOctreeQuantizer``1
member.summary: This method doesn't actually do anything but serves an important purpose... If you are running ImageSharp on iOS and try to call SaveAsGif, it will throw an exception: "Attempting to JIT compile method... OctreeFrameQuantizer.ConstructPalette... while running in aot-only mode." The reason this happens is the SaveAsGif method makes heavy use of generics, which are too confusing for the AoT compiler used on Xamarin.iOS. It spins up the JIT compiler to try and figure it out, but that is an illegal op on iOS so it bombs out. If you are getting the above error, you need to call this method, which will pre-seed the AoT compiler with the necessary methods to complete the SaveAsGif call. That's it, otherwise you should NEVER need this method!!!

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCompileWuQuantizer``1
member.summary: This method pre-seeds the WuQuantizer in the AoT compiler for iOS.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCompileDithering``1
member.summary: This method pre-seeds the default dithering engine (FloydSteinbergDiffuser) in the AoT compiler for iOS.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCodec``1(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.IImageDecoder,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.IImageEncoder)
member.summary: This method pre-seeds the decoder and encoder for a given pixel format in the AoT compiler for iOS.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCompilePixelOperations``1
member.summary: This method pre-seeds the PixelOperations engine for the AoT compiler on iOS.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Advanced.AotCompilerTools.AotCompileResizeOperations``1
member.summary: This method pre-seeds the ResizeProcessor for the AoT compiler on iOS.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for the class.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.WhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used for chromatic adaptation in conversions from/to XYZ color space. When default, no adaptation will be performed. Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLuvWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Luv/LChuv colors. (Luv/LChuv colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Lab/LChab colors. (Lab/LChab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetHunterLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* HunterLab colors. (HunterLab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetRgbWorkingSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target working space used *when creating* RGB colors. (RGB colors on the input already contain the working space information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation method used. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.LmsAdaptationMatrix
member.summary: Gets or sets transformation matrix used in conversion to and from .

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Chromatic adaptation. A linear transformation of a source color (XS, YS, ZS) into a destination color (XD, YD, ZD) by a linear transformation [M] which is dependent on the source reference white (XWS, YWS, ZWS) and the destination reference white (XWD, YWD, ZWD).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation.Transform(SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@)
member.summary: Performs a linear transformation of a source color in to the destination color.
member.remarks: Doesn't crop the resulting color space coordinates (e. g. allows negative values for XYZ coordinates).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation.Transform(System.ReadOnlySpan{SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz},System.Span{SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz},SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz,SixLabors.ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz@)
member.summary: Performs a bulk linear transformation of a source color in to the destination color.
member.remarks: Doesn't crop the resulting color space coordinates (e. g. allows negative values for XYZ coordinates).
member.param: The span to the source colors.
The span to the destination colors.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Color
member.content: Contains constructors and implicit conversion methods.
member.summary: Represents a color value that is convertible to any type.
member.remarks: The internal representation and layout of this structure is hidden by intention. It's not serializable, and it should not be considered as part of a contract. Unlike System.Drawing.Color, has to be converted to a specific pixel value to query the color components.
member.content: Contains static named color values.
Contains the definition of .

member.summary: Enumerates the available bits per pixel the bitmap encoder supports.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 1 byte.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 2 bytes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 3 bytes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 4 bytes.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression
member.summary: Defines the compression type of the image data in the bitmap file.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BI_ALPHABITFIELDS
member.summary: Introduced with Windows CE. Specifies that the bitmap is not compressed and that the color table consists of four DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, blue, and alpha components of each pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE24
member.summary:
OS/2 specific compression type. Similar to run length encoding of 4 and 8 bit. The only difference is that run values encoded are three bytes in size (one byte per RGB color component), rather than four or eight bits in size.
Note: Because compression value of 4 is ambiguous for BI_RGB for windows and RLE24 for OS/2, the enum value is remapped to a different value, to be clearly separate from valid windows values.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
Some OS/2 specific subtypes like: Bitmap Array, Color Icon, Color Pointer, Icon, Pointer.
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle4(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE4 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE4 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte contains two color indexes.
member.param: Keeps track over skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle8(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE8 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE8 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte is the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle24(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE24 stream.
member.remarks:
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and following three bytes are the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpEncoder.SupportTransparency
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the encoder should support transparency. Note: Transparency support only works together with 32 bits per pixel. This option will change the default behavior of the encoder of writing a bitmap version 3 info header with no compression. Instead a bitmap version 4 info header will be written with the BITFIELDS compression.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpFileHeader
member.summary: Stores general information about the Bitmap file.
member.remarks: The first two bytes of the Bitmap file format (thus the Bitmap header) are stored in big-endian order. All of the other integer values are stored in little-endian format (i.e. least-significant byte first).

member.summary: Gets the Bitmap identifier. The field used to identify the bitmap file: 0x42 0x4D (Hex code points for B and M)

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpFileHeader.FileSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the bitmap file in bytes.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpFileHeader.Reserved
member.summary: Gets any reserved data; actual value depends on the application that creates the image.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpFileHeader.Offset
member.summary: Gets the offset, i.e. starting address, of the byte where the bitmap data can be found.

member.summary: Defines the size of the field.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseCore(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses the BITMAPCOREHEADER (BMP Version 2) consisting of the headerSize, width, height, planes, and bitsPerPixel fields (12 bytes).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseOs22Short(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses a short variant of the OS22XBITMAPHEADER. It is identical to the BITMAPCOREHEADER, except that the width and height are 4 bytes instead of 2, resulting in 16 bytes total.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseV3(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses the full BMP Version 3 BITMAPINFOHEADER header (40 bytes).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseAdobeV3(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Special case of the BITMAPINFOHEADER V3 used by adobe where the color bitmasks are part of the info header instead of following it. 52 bytes without the alpha mask, 56 bytes with the alpha mask.
member.param: Indicates, if the alpha bitmask is present.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseOs2Version2(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses a OS/2 version 2 bitmap header (64 bytes). Only the first 40 bytes are parsed which are very similar to the Bitmap v3 header. The other 24 bytes are ignored, but they do not hold any useful information for decoding the image.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.ParseV4(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Parses the full BMP Version 4 BITMAPINFOHEADER header (108 bytes).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.WriteV3Header(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Writes a bitmap version 3 (Microsoft Windows NT) header to a buffer (40 bytes).

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeader.WriteV4Header(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Writes a complete Bitmap V4 header to a buffer.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Bmp.BmpInfoHeaderType

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the encoder should support transparency. Note: Transparency support only works together with 32 bits per pixel. This option will change the default behavior of the encoder of writing a bitmap version 3 info header with no compression. Instead a bitmap version 4 info header will be written with the BITFIELDS compression.

The clock starts ticking immediately after the graphic is rendered.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and compresses the image data using dynamic Lempel-Ziv compression.
member.remarks:
Adapted from Jef Poskanzer's Java port by way of J. M. G. Elliott. K Weiner 12/00
GIFCOMPR.C - GIF Image compression routines
Lempel-Ziv compression based on 'compress'. GIF modifications by David Rowley (mgardi@watdcsu.waterloo.edu)
GIF Image compression - modified 'compress'
Based on: compress.c - File compression ala IEEE Computer, June 1984. By Authors: Spencer W. Thomas (decvax!harpo!utah-cs!utah-gr!thomas) Jim McKie (decvax!mcvax!jim) Steve Davies (decvax!vax135!petsd!peora!srd) Ken Turkowski (decvax!decwrl!turtlevax!ken) James A. Woods (decvax!ihnp4!ames!jaw) Joe Orost (decvax!vax135!petsd!joe)

member.summary: Block compression parameters -- after all codes are used up, and compression rate changes, start over.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.globalInitialBits
member.summary: Algorithm: use open addressing double hashing (no chaining) on the prefix code / next character combination. We do a variant of Knuth's algorithm D (vol. 3, sec. 6.4) along with G. Knott's relatively-prime secondary probe. Here, the modular division first probe is gives way to a faster exclusive-or manipulation. Also do block compression with an adaptive reset, whereby the code table is cleared when the compression ratio decreases, but after the table fills. The variable-length output codes are re-sized at this point, and a special CLEAR code is generated for the decompressor. Late addition: construct the table according to file size for noticeable speed improvement on small files. Please direct questions about this implementation to ames!jaw.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.clearCode
member.summary: The clear code.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.eofCode
member.summary: The end-of-file code.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.LzwEncoder.currentAccumulator
member.summary: Output the given code. Inputs: code: A bitCount-bit integer. If == -1, then EOF. This assumes that bitCount =< wordsize - 1. Outputs: Outputs code to the file. Assumptions: Chars are 8 bits long. Algorithm: Maintain a BITS character long buffer (so that 8 codes will fit in it exactly). Use the VAX insv instruction to insert each code in turn. When the buffer fills up empty it and start over.

member.summary: Represents a Huffman coding table containing basic coding data plus tables for accelerated computation.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.Sizes
member.summary: Derived from the DHT marker. Sizes[k] = # of symbols with codes of length k bits; Sizes[0] is unused.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.Values
member.summary: Derived from the DHT marker. Contains the symbols, in order of incremental code length.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.MaxCode
member.summary: Contains the largest code of length k (0 if none). MaxCode[17] is a sentinel to ensure terminates.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.ValOffset
member.summary: Values[] offset for codes of length k ValOffset[k] = Values[] index of 1st symbol of code length k, less the smallest code of length k; so given a code of length k, the corresponding symbol is Values[code + ValOffset[k]].

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadSize
member.summary: Contains the length of bits for the given k value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadValue
member.summary:
Lookahead table: indexed by the next bits of the input data stream. If the next Huffman code is no more than bits long, we can obtain its length and the corresponding symbol directly from this tables.
The lower 8 bits of each table entry contain the number of bits in the corresponding Huffman code, or + 1 if too long. The next 8 bits of each entry contain the symbol.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.JpegImagePostProcessor
member.summary:
Encapsulates the execution od post-processing algorithms to be applied on a to produce a valid :
(1) Dequantization
(2) IDCT
(3) Color conversion form one of the -s into a buffer of RGBA values
(4) Packing pixels from the buffer.
These operations are executed in steps. image rows are converted in one step, which means that size of the allocated memory is limited (does not depend on ).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag
member.summary: Holds the Jpeg UnZig array in a value/stack type. Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Size
member.summary: When reading corrupted data, the Huffman decoders could attempt to reference an entry beyond the end of this array (if the decoded zero run length reaches past the end of the block). To prevent wild stores without adding an inner-loop test, we put some extra "63"s after the real entries. This will cause the extra coefficient to be stored in location 63 of the block, not somewhere random. The worst case would be a run-length of 15, which means we need 16 fake entries.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Data
member.summary: Copy of in a value type

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Unzig
member.summary: Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.SosHeaderYCbCr
member.summary: Gets the SOS (Start Of Scan) marker "\xff\xda" followed by 12 bytes: - the marker length "\x00\x0c", - the number of components "\x03", - component 1 uses DC table 0 and AC table 0 "\x01\x00", - component 2 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x02\x11", - component 3 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x03\x11", - the bytes "\x00\x3f\x00". Section B.2.3 of the spec says that for sequential DCTs, those bytes (8-bit Ss, 8-bit Se, 4-bit Ah, 4-bit Al) should be 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00<<4 | 0x00.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.UnscaledQuant_Luminance
member.summary: Gets the unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.UnscaledQuant_Chrominance
member.summary: Gets the unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of the various PNG filter types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the Sub filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value. This technique is due to Alan W. Paeth

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Filters.NoneFilter

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit2
member.summary: 2 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit4
member.summary: 4 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit8
member.summary: 8 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit16
member.summary: 16 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets the chunk type. The value is the equal to the UInt32BigEndian encoding of its 4 ASCII characters.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length or null.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Crc
member.summary: Gets a CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) calculated on the preceding bytes in the chunk, including the chunk type code and chunk data fields, but not including the length field. The CRC is always present, even for chunks containing no data

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunk.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the given chunk is critical to decoding

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType
member.summary: Contains a list of chunk types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Exif
member.summary: The eXIf data chunk which contains the Exif profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.CompressedText
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image. The zTXt and tEXt chunks are semantically equivalent, but the zTXt chunk is recommended for storing large blocks of text. Each zTXt chunk contains a (uncompressed) keyword and a compressed text string.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.InternationalText
member.summary: The iTXt chunk contains International textual data. It contains a keyword, an optional language tag, an optional translated keyword and the actual text string, which can be compressed or uncompressed.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Transparency
member.summary: The tRNS chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Palette
member.summary: Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk must appear.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngColorType.RgbWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConfigurationModule
member.summary: Registers the image encoders, decoders and mime type detectors for the png format.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants
member.summary: Defines Png constants defined in the specification.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.Encoding
member.summary: The character encoding to use when reading and writing textual data keywords and text - (Latin-1 ISO-8859-1).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.LanguageEncoding
member.summary: The character encoding to use when reading and writing language tags within iTXt chunks - (ASCII 7bit).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.TranslatedEncoding
member.summary: The character encoding to use when reading and writing translated textual data keywords and text - (UTF8).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.MimeTypes
member.summary: The list of mimetypes that equate to a Png.

member.summary: The list of file extensions that equate to a Png.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.HeaderBytes
member.summary: The header bytes identifying a Png.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.HeaderValue
member.summary: The header bytes as a big-endian coded ulong.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.ColorTypes
member.summary: The dictionary of available color types.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.MaxTextKeywordLength
member.summary: The maximum length of keyword in a text chunk is 79 bytes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngConstants.MinTextKeywordLength
member.summary: The minimum length of a keyword in a text chunk is 1 byte.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngDecoder
member.summary: Encoder for generating an image out of a png encoded stream.
member.remarks:
At the moment the following features are supported:
Filters: all filters are supported.
Pixel formats:
RGBA (True color) with alpha (8 bit).
RGB (True color) without alpha (8 bit).
grayscale with alpha (8 bit).
grayscale without alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index with alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index without alpha (8 bit).

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG filter methods.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Adaptive
member.summary: Computes the output scanline using all five filters, and selects the filter that gives the smallest sum of absolute values of outputs. This method usually outperforms any single fixed filter choice.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Zlib.Adler32
member.summary: Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
member.remarks:
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Zlib.Adler32.Base
member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.summary: The checksum calculated to far.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Zlib.Adler32.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The checksum starts off with a value of 1.

member.summary: Updates the checksum with a byte value.
member.param: The data value to add. The high byte of the int is ignored.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Png.Zlib.Crc32
member.summary: Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.

remarks.para: Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.

This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.

The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.summary: The cycle redundancy check seed

member.summary: The table of all possible eight bit values for fast lookup.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.GraphicsOptions.IsOpaqueColorWithoutBlending(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Evaluates if a given SOURCE color can completely replace a BACKDROP color given the current blending and composition settings.
member.returns: true if the color can be considered opaque
member.remarks: Blending and composition is an expensive operation, in some cases, like filling with a solid color, the blending can be avoided by a plain color replacement. This method can be useful for such processors to select the fast path.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Memory.MemorySource`1
member.summary: Holds a that is either OWNED or CONSUMED. When the memory is being owned, the instance is also known. Implements content transfer logic in that depends on the ownership status. This is needed to transfer the contents of a temporary to a persistent without copying the buffer.
member.remarks:
For a deeper understanding of the owner/consumer model, check out the following docs:
https://gist.github.com/GrabYourPitchforks/4c3e1935fd4d9fa2831dbfcab35dffc6 https://www.codemag.com/Article/1807051/Introducing-.NET-Core-2.1-Flagship-Types-Span-T-and-Memory-T

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusA
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response. This is the accepted standard for reflection densitometers for measuring photographic color prints

member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response which is the accepted standard in Europe for color reflection densitometers

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusI
member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response commonly referred to as narrow band or interference-type response.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccCurveMeasurementEncodings.StatusT
member.summary: ISO 5-3 wide band color reflection densitometer response which is the accepted standard in the United States for color reflection densitometers

member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response for measuring color negatives

member.summary: DIN 16536-2 densitometer response, with no polarizing filter

member.summary: DIN 16536-2 densitometer response, with polarizing filter

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.DateTime
member.summary: A 12-byte value representation of the time and date

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Float32
member.summary: A single-precision 32-bit floating-point as specified in IEEE 754, excluding un-normalized s, infinities, and not a "" (NaN) values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Position
member.summary: Positions of some data elements are indicated using a position offset with the data element's size.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Response16
member.summary: An 8-byte value, used to associate a normalized device code with a measurement value

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.S15Fixed16
member.summary: A fixed signed 4-byte (32-bit) quantity which has 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U16Fixed16
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 4-byte (32-bit) quantity having 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U1Fixed15
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) quantity having15 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.U8Fixed8
member.summary: A fixed unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) quantity having 8 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt16
member.summary: An unsigned 2-byte (16-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt32
member.summary: An unsigned 4-byte (32-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt64
member.summary: An unsigned 8-byte (64-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.UInt8
member.summary: An unsigned 1-byte (8-bit) integer

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Xyz
member.summary: A set of three fixed signed 4-byte (32-bit) quantities used to encode CIEXYZ, nCIEXYZ, and PCSXYZ tristimulus values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccDataType.Ascii
member.summary: Alpha-numeric values, and other input and output codes, shall conform to the American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) specified in ISO/IEC 646.

member.summary: Set of curves

member.summary: Matrix transformation

member.summary: Color lookup table

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.BAcs
member.summary: Reserved for future expansion. Do not use!

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccMultiProcessElementSignature.EAcs
member.summary: Reserved for future expansion. Do not use!

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType
member.summary: Formula curve segment type

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Type1
member.summary: Type 1: Y = X^g

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Cie122_1996
member.summary:
CIE 122-1996:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = 0

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Iec61966_3
member.summary:
IEC 61966-3:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = c

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.SRgb
member.summary:
IEC 61966-2-1 (sRGB):
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccParametricCurveType.Type5
member.summary:
Type 5:
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X + f

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass
member.summary: Profile Class Name

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.InputDevice
member.summary: Input profiles are generally used with devices such as scanners and digital cameras. The types of profiles available for use as Input profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.DisplayDevice
member.summary: This class of profiles represents display devices such as monitors. The types of profiles available for use as Display profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.OutputDevice
member.summary: Output profiles are used to support devices such as printers and film recorders. The types of profiles available for use as Output profiles are N-component LUT-based and Monochrome.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.DeviceLink
member.summary: This profile contains a pre-evaluated transform that cannot be undone, which represents a one-way link or connection between devices. It does not represent any device model nor can it be embedded into images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.ColorSpace
member.summary: This profile provides the relevant information to perform a transformation between color encodings and the PCS. This type of profile is based on modeling rather than device measurement or characterization data. ColorSpace profiles may be embedded in images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.Abstract
member.summary: This profile represents abstract transforms and does not represent any device model. Color transformations using Abstract profiles are performed from PCS to PCS. Abstract profiles cannot be embedded in images.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileClass.NamedColor
member.summary: NamedColor profiles can be thought of as sibling profiles to device profiles. For a given device there would be one or more device profiles to handle process color conversions and one or more named color profiles to handle named colors.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag
member.summary: Profile flags. Can be combined with a logical OR. The least-significant 16 bits are reserved for the ICC, the rest can be used for vendor specific values

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.None
member.summary: No flags (equivalent to NotEmbedded and Independent)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.Embedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.NotEmbedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.NotIndependent
member.summary: Profile cannot be used independently of the embedded color data

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileFlag.Independent
member.summary: Profile can be used independently of the embedded color data

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag
member.summary:
Enumerates the ICC Profile Tags as defined in ICC.1:2010 version 4.3.0.0 Section 9
Each tag value represent the size of the tag in the profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB0
member.summary: A2B0 - This tag defines a color transform from Device, Color Encoding or PCS, to PCS, or a color transform from Device 1 to Device 2, using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB1
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the color transform from Device or Color Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.AToB2
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the color transform from Device or Color Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BlueMatrixColumn
member.summary: bXYZ - This tag contains the third column in the matrix used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BlueTrc
member.summary: bTRC - This tag contains the blue channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (blue) or 100 % phosphor (blue).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA0
member.summary: B2A0 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA1
member.summary: B2A1 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToA2
member.summary: B2A2 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device or Color Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD0
member.summary: B2D0 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA0 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD1
member.summary: B2D1 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD2
member.summary: B2D2 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA2 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.BToD3
member.summary: B2D3 - This tag defines a color transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.CalibrationDateTime
member.summary: calt - This tag contains the profile calibration date and time. This allows applications and utilities to verify if this profile matches a vendor's profile and how recently calibration has been performed.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.CharTarget
member.summary: targ - This tag contains the name of the registered characterization data set, or it contains the measurement data for a characterization target.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: chad - This tag contains a matrix, which shall be invertible, and which converts an nCIEXYZ color, measured using the actual illumination conditions and relative to the actual adopted white, to an nCIEXYZ color relative to the PCS adopted white

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Chromaticity
member.summary: chrm - This tag contains the type and the data of the phosphor/colorant chromaticity set used.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantOrder
member.summary: clro - This tag specifies the laydown order of colorants.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantTable
member.summary: clrt

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorantTableOut
member.summary: clot - This tag identifies the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values. When used in DeviceLink profiles only the PCSLAB values shall be permitted.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ColorimetricIntentImageStat
member.summary: ciis - This tag indicates the image state of PCS colorimetry produced using the colorimetric intent transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Copyright
member.summary: cprt - This tag contains the text copyright information for the profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.CrdInfo
member.summary: crdi - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Data
member.summary: data - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DateTime
member.summary: dtim - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DeviceManufacturerDescription
member.summary: dmnd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device manufacturer for display

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DeviceModelDescription
member.summary: dmdd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device model for display.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DeviceSettings
member.summary: devs - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB0
member.summary: D2B0 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB0 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB1
member.summary: D2B1 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB2
member.summary: D2B2 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.DToB3
member.summary: D2B3 - This tag defines a color transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Gamut
member.summary: gamt - This tag provides a table in which PCS values are the input and a single output value for each input value is the output. If the output value is 0, the PCS color is in-gamut. If the output is non-zero, the PCS color is out-of-gamut

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GrayTrc
member.summary: kTRC - This tag contains the grey tone reproduction curve. The tone reproduction curve provides the necessary information to convert between a single device channel and the PCSXYZ or PCSLAB encoding.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GreenMatrixColumn
member.summary: gXYZ - This tag contains the second column in the matrix, which is used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.GreenTrc
member.summary: gTRC - This tag contains the green channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (green) or 100 % phosphor (green).

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Luminance
member.summary: lumi - This tag contains the absolute luminance of emissive devices in candelas per square meter as described by the Y channel.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Measurement
member.summary: meas - This tag describes the alternative measurement specification, such as a D65 illuminant instead of the default D50.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.MediaBlackPoint
member.summary: bkpt - Removed in V4

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.MediaWhitePoint
member.summary: wtpt - This tag, which is used for generating the ICC-absolute colorimetric intent, specifies the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the media white point.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.NamedColor
member.summary: ncol - OBSOLETE, use

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.NamedColor2
member.summary: ncl2 - This tag contains the named color information providing a PCS and optional device representation for a list of named colors.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.OutputResponse
member.summary: resp - This tag describes the structure containing a description of the device response for which the profile is intended.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.PerceptualRenderingIntentGamut
member.summary: rig0 - There is only one standard reference medium gamut, as defined in ISO 12640-3

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Preview0
member.summary: pre0 - This tag contains the preview transformation from PCS to device space and back to the PCS.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Preview1
member.summary: pre1 - This tag defines the preview transformation from PCS to device space and back to the PCS.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.Preview2
member.summary: pre2 - This tag contains the preview transformation from PCS to device space and back to the PCS.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ProfileDescription
member.summary: desc - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the profile description for display.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccProfileTag.ProfileSequenceDescription
member.summary: pseq - This tag describes the structure containing a description of the profile sequence from source to destination, typically used with the DeviceLink profile.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent
member.summary: Rendering intent

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: In perceptual transforms the PCS values represent hypothetical measurements of a color reproduction on the reference reflective medium. By extension, for the perceptual intent, the PCS represents the appearance of that reproduction as viewed in the reference viewing environment by a human observer adapted to that environment. The exact color rendering of the perceptual intent is vendor specific.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.MediaRelativeColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall re-scale the in-gamut, chromatically adapted tristimulus values such that the white point of the actual medium is mapped to the PCS white point (for either input or output)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.Saturation
member.summary: The exact color rendering of the saturation intent is vendor specific and involves compromises such as trading off preservation of hue in order to preserve the vividness of pure colors.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccRenderingIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall leave the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the in-gamut colors unchanged.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature
member.summary: Type Signature

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown type signature

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Chromaticity
member.summary: The chromaticity tag type provides basic chromaticity data and type of phosphors or colorants of a monitor to applications and utilities

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ColorantOrder
member.summary: This is an optional tag which specifies the laydown order in which colorants will be printed on an n-colorant device. The laydown order may be the same as the channel generation order listed in the colorantTableTag or the channel order of a color encoding type such as CMYK, in which case this tag is not needed. When this is not the case (for example, ink-towers sometimes use the order KCMY), this tag may be used to specify the laydown order of the colorants

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ColorantTable
member.summary: The purpose of this tag is to identify the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values to give the colorant an unambiguous value. The first colorant listed is the colorant of the first device channel of a LUT tag. The second colorant listed is the colorant of the second device channel of a LUT tag, and so on

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Curve
member.summary: The curveType embodies a one-dimensional function which maps an input value in the domain of the function to an output value in the range of the function

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Data
member.summary: The dataType is a simple data structure that contains either 7-bit ASCII or binary data

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time defined by 6 unsigned 16bit integers (year, month, day, hour, minute, second)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Lut16
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform using tables with 16-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 × 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input color space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Lut8
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform using tables of 8-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 × 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input color space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.LutAToB
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the AToBTag tag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 × 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output curves

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.LutBToA
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the BToATag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 × 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional curves.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Measurement
member.summary: This information refers only to the internal profile data and is meant to provide profile makers an alternative to the default measurement specifications

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.MultiLocalizedUnicode
member.summary: This tag structure contains a set of records each referencing a multilingual Unicode string associated with a profile. Each string is referenced in a separate record with the information about what language and region the string is for.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.MultiProcessElements
member.summary: This structure represents a color transform, containing a sequence of processing elements. The processing elements contained in the structure are defined in the structure itself, allowing for a flexible structure. Currently supported processing elements are: a set of one dimensional curves, a matrix with offset terms, and a multidimensional lookup table (CLUT). Other processing element types may be added in the future. Each type of processing element may be contained any number of times in the structure.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor2
member.summary: This type is a count value and array of structures that provide color coordinates for color names. For each named color, a PCS and optional device representation of the color are given. Both representations are 16-bit values and PCS values shall be relative colorimetric. The device representation corresponds to the header’s "data color space" field. This representation should be consistent with the "number of device coordinates" field in the namedColor2Type. If this field is 0, device coordinates are not provided. The PCS representation corresponds to the header's PCS field. The PCS representation is always provided. Color names are fixed-length, 32-byte fields including null termination. In order to maintain maximum portability, it is strongly recommended that special characters of the 7-bit ASCII set not be used.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ParametricCurve
member.summary: This type describes a one-dimensional curve by specifying one of a predefined set of functions using the parameters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceDesc
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information from the header fields and tags from the original profiles which were combined to create the final profile. The order of the structures is the order in which the profiles were combined and includes a structure for the final profile. This provides a description of the profile sequence from source to destination, typically used with the DeviceLink profile.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceIdentifier
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information for identification of a profile used in a sequence.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ResponseCurveSet16
member.summary: The purpose of this tag type is to provide a mechanism to relate physical colorant amounts with the normalized device codes produced by lut8Type, lut16Type, lutAToBType, lutBToAType or multiProcessElementsType tags so that corrections can be made for variation in the device without having to produce a new profile. The mechanism can be used by applications to allow users with relatively inexpensive and readily available instrumentation to apply corrections to individual output color channels in order to achieve consistent results.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.S15Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of signed floating point numbers with 1 sign bit, 15 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Signature
member.summary: The signatureType contains a 4-byte sequence. Sequences of less than four characters are padded at the end with spaces. Typically this type is used for registered tags that can be displayed on many development systems as a sequence of four characters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Text
member.summary: Simple ASCII text

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.U16Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned floating point numbers with 16 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 16bit integers (ushort)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt32Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 32bit integers (uint)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt64Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 64bit integers (ulong)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UInt8Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 8bit integers (byte)

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.ViewingConditions
member.summary: This type represents a set of viewing condition parameters.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Xyz
member.summary: 3 floating point values describing a XYZ color value

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.TextDescription
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The textDescriptionType is a complex structure that contains three types of text description structures: 7-bit ASCII, Unicode and ScriptCode. Since no single standard method for specifying localizable character sets exists across the major platform vendors, including all three provides access for the major operating systems. The 7-bit ASCII description is to be an invariant, nonlocalizable name for consistent reference. It is preferred that both the Unicode and ScriptCode structures be properly localized.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.CrdInfo
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains the PostScript product name to which this profile corresponds and the names of the companion CRDs

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.Screening
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The screeningType describes various screening parameters including screen frequency, screening angle, and spot shape

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.UcrBg
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains curves representing the under color removal and black generation and a text string which is a general description of the method used for the UCR and BG

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.DeviceSettings
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type is an array of structures each of which contains platform-specific information about the settings of the device for which this profile is valid. This type is not supported.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Metadata.Profiles.Icc.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor
member.summary: REMOVED IN V2 - use instead. This type is not supported.

For example in the pixel format the R component is the least significant byte, and the A component is the most significant.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.DefaultPixelBlenders`1
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying different composition models.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff Color Blending and Alpha Composition Functions.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Normal(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Source over backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Multiply(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Source multiplied by backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Add(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Source added to backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Subtract(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Source subtracted from backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Screen(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Complement of source multiplied by the complement of backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Darken(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Per element, chooses the smallest value of source and backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Lighten(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Per element, chooses the largest value of source and backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.Overlay(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Overlays source over backdrop

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.HardLight(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Hard light effect

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions.OverlayValueFunction(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Helper function for Overlay andHardLight modes

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode
member.summary: Enumerates the various color blending modes.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Normal
member.summary: Default blending mode, also known as "Normal" or "Alpha Blending"

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Multiply
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by multiplication.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Add
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by addition.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Subtract
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by subtraction.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the values, depending on the backdrop vector values.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source value.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Argb32
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in alpha, red, green, and blue order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
