member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in blue, green, red, and alpha order (least significant to most significant byte). The format is binary compatible with System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Rgba32
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides standardized definitions for named colors.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Rgba64
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 16-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 65535.
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.RgbaVector
member.summary:
Unpacked pixel type containing four 32-bit floating-point values typically ranging from 0 to 1. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order.
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Utils.PixelConverter
member.summary: Contains optimized implementations for conversion between pixel formats.
member.remarks: Implementations are based on ideas in: https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/src/System.Private.CoreLib/shared/System/Buffers/Binary/Reader.cs#L84 The JIT can detect and optimize rotation idioms ROTL (Rotate Left) and ROTR (Rotate Right) emitting efficient CPU instructions: https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/pull/1830

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateBrightnessFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a brightness filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely black. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing brighter results.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateContrastFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a contrast filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely gray. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing results with more contrast.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt601Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.601.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt709Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.709.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateHueFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a hue filter matrix using the given angle in degrees.
member.param: The angle of rotation in degrees.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateInvertFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an invert filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateOpacityFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an opacity filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSaturateFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a saturation filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 is completely un-saturated. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of amount over 1 are allowed, providing super-saturated results
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSepiaFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a sepia filter matrix using the given amount. The formula used matches the svg specification.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known quantizing algorithms

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Octree
member.summary: Gets the adaptive Octree quantizer. Fast with good quality.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Wu
member.summary: Gets the Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer which generates high quality output.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.WebSafe
member.summary: Gets the palette based quantizer consisting of web safe colors as defined in the CSS Color Module Level 4.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Werner
member.summary: Gets the palette based quantizer consisting of colors as defined in the original second edition of Werner’s Nomenclature of Colours 1821. The hex codes were collected and defined by Nicholas Rougeux

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known resampling algorithms

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Bicubic
member.summary: Gets the Bicubic sampler that implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x)

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Box
member.summary: Gets the Box sampler that implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging pixels together.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.CatmullRom
member.summary: Gets the Catmull-Rom sampler, a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Hermite
member.summary: Gets the Hermite sampler. A type of smoothed triangular interpolation filter that rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos2
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 2 pixels. This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos3
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 3 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos5
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 5 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos8
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 8 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.MitchellNetravali
member.summary: Gets the Mitchell-Netravali sampler. This seperable cubic algorithm yields a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Gets the Nearest-Neighbour sampler that implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses a very fast, unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Robidoux
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux sampler. This algorithm developed by Nicolas Robidoux providing a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness comparable to .

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.RobidouxSharp
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux Sharp sampler. A sharpened form of the sampler

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Spline
member.summary: Gets the Spline sampler. A seperable cubic algorithm similar to but yielding smoother results.

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Triangle
member.summary: Gets the Triangle sampler, otherwise known as Bilinear. This interpolation algorithm can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels

member.name: P:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.KnownResamplers.Welch
member.summary: Gets the Welch sampler. A high speed algorithm that delivers very sharpened results.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.AdaptiveHistogramEqualizationProcessor
member.summary: Applies an adaptive histogram equalization to the image. The image is split up in tiles. For each tile a cumulative distribution function (cdf) is calculated. To calculate the final equalized pixel value, the cdf value of four adjacent tiles will be interpolated.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.AdaptiveHistogramEqualizationProcessor.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The number of different luminance levels. Typical values are 256 for 8-bit grayscale images or 65536 for 16-bit grayscale images.
Indicating whether to clip the histogram bins at a specific value.
Histogram clip limit in percent of the total pixels in the tile. Histogram bins which exceed this limit, will be capped at this value.
The number of tiles the image is split into (horizontal and vertically). Minimum value is 2. Maximum value is 100.

member.summary: Gets the number of tiles the image is split into (horizontal and vertically) for the adaptive histogram equalization.

Applies the sliding window equalization to one column of the image. The window is moved from top to bottom. Moving the window one pixel down requires to remove one row from the top of the window from the histogram and adding a new row at the bottom.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Normalization.HistogramEqualizationProcessor`1.ClipHistogram(System.Span{System.Int32},System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: AHE tends to over amplify the contrast in near-constant regions of the image, since the histogram in such regions is highly concentrated. Clipping the histogram is meant to reduce this effect, by cutting of histogram bin's which exceed a certain amount and redistribute the values over the clip limit to all other bins equally.
member.param: The histogram to apply the clipping.
Histogram clip limit in percent of the total pixels in the tile. Histogram bins which exceed this limit, will be capped at this value.
The numbers of pixels inside the tile.

member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by Jérémy Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer`1.Variance(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer{`0}.Box@)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

member.name: M:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer`1.Maximize(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer{`0}.Box@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.BicubicResampler
member.summary: The function implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x) as described on Wikipedia A commonly used algorithm within image processing that preserves sharpness better than triangle interpolation.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.BoxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging together.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.CatmullRomResampler
member.summary: The Catmull-Rom filter is a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function. This filter produces a reasonably sharp edge, but without a the pronounced gradient change on large scale image enlargements that a 'Lagrange' filter can produce.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.HermiteResampler
member.summary: The Hermite filter is type of smoothed triangular interpolation Filter, This filter rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.Processors.Transforms.ResizeWorker`1
member.summary: Implements the resize algorithm using a sliding window of size maximized by . The height of the window is a multiple of the vertical kernel's maximum diameter. When sliding the window, the contents of the bottom window band are copied to the new top band. For more details, and visual explanation, see "ResizeWorker.pptx".

member.name: T:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode
member.summary: Provides enumeration over how the image should be resized.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Crop
member.summary: Crops the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Pad
member.summary: Pads the resized image to fit the bounds of its container. If only one dimension is passed, will maintain the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.BoxPad
member.summary: Pads the image to fit the bound of the container without resizing the original source. When downscaling, performs the same functionality as

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Constrains the resized image to fit the bounds of its container maintaining the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Min
member.summary: Resizes the image until the shortest side reaches the set given dimension. Upscaling is disabled in this mode and the original image will be returned if attempted.

member.name: F:SixLabors.ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.summary: Returns the angle whose tangent is the quotient of two specified numbers.

The x coordinate of a point.
member.returns: An angle, θ, measured in radians, such that -π≤θ≤π, and tan(θ) = y / x, where (x, y) is a point in the Cartesian plane. Observe the following: For (x, y) in quadrant 1, 0 < θ < π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 2, π/2 < θ≤π.For (x, y) in quadrant 3, -π < θ < -π/2.For (x, y) in quadrant 4, -π/2 < θ < 0.For points on the boundaries of the quadrants, the return value is the following:If y is 0 and x is not negative, θ = 0.If y is 0 and x is negative, θ = π.If y is positive and x is 0, θ = π/2.If y is negative and x is 0, θ = -π/2.If y is 0 and x is 0, θ = 0. If x or y is , or if x and y are either or , the method returns .
